intro: Centranthera, commonly known as the common centranthera, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. These plants are native to various regions of Africa, particularly in the arid and semi-arid zones. They are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their compound leaves and small, often fragrant flowers. Centranthera species are known for their ability to thrive in poor soils and withstand drought conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
